channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2024030167
item.description:
Report E-2024030167

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: JONESBORO
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 50 gallons of 2,4-D (UN3082) was released from an IBC tote due to a forklift incident. The release impacted the concrete dock. The SDS was reviewed with the caller and it was determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (3) 55 gallon DF contains product only and (1) 30 gal df containing product and PPE was created onsite and left for the terminal to manage. NO drains, soil or waterways were noted to be impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024030121
item.description:
Report E-2024030121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a punctured 1-gallon can of Amercoat 253. A forklift punctured the can during the offloading process and released 1-gallon of product onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and overpacked the damaged product. One drum of waste was produced for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024021757
item.description:
Report X-2024021757

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED AT OUR FACILITY UPSIDE DOWN IN A BLACK TOTE INSIDE THE TRAILER. This CAUSED PRESSURE TO THE LID SEAL CAUSING SLIGHT LEAKAGE FROM 1 BOTTLE.. DescribePack: lid SEAL LEAKAGE DUE TO PRESSURE. SLIGHT CRACK IN LID SEAL 1/8TH OF AN INCH. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A RED HAZMAT TOTE AND LINER. package WAS PLACED UPRIGHT.

item.title: Report X-2024021798
item.description:
Report X-2024021798

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: FORT SMITH
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Noticed bottom of box was wet DescribePack: shipper put 2 inner jugs upside down in box so orientation arrows on outside had box contents moved through network upside down. After continued handling and movement closure started leaking causing bottom of box to be wet and contents burst through box when picked up. only leakage was on bottom of box and minimal on floor where box was at when picked up. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: used absorbent pads to clean up spill and placed in hazmat container waiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024030012
item.description:
Report E-2024030012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: TEXARKANA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10-gallons of ENILEX NI-5A Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s (UN1760, 8, III) released from (2) 5-gallon pails. The release was caused by a puncture from a pallet due to a load shift. The release impacted a 53’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor, the side of the trailer, and a 60’ x 1’ area of asphalt. E3 Environmental was able to neutralize and clean the release with absorbents, and the proper PPE. The remaining cargo was shrink wrapped, restacked, and secured for transit along with the overpack. All waste was containerized in (3) 55-gallon poly drums, which was then taken offsite by the E3 Environmental for proper disposal.
